page.title: 10SUMMER FAYRE 1985 HAXBY
page.content: } Summer Fayre day 1985 was on 29th June at Headlands County Primary School, Haxby, near York.It is organised by the school and its Parent Teacher Association. The first thing we had to do was to sell programmes, they cost 20 pence each.I helped my Mum and Dad they were on the Treasure Island stall, people had to stick a flag where they thought the treasure was hidden. My brother helped on the goldfish stall. There were lots of other attractions including:- Toys,Darts,Candy Floss, Hoop-La, American Bar,Lucky Dip,Bouncy Castle and Swing Boats. The Army 2nd Signal Division brought a lot of equipment and there were Karate and Gymnastics displays. A very action packed Summer Fayre raised over Â£1000 for school funds.
